title: Would Stalin have taken part in WW2 if Hitler never attacked USSR? - Quora

response.answer_text: Soviet Union did took a part in WWII before Hitler attack. On the side of Hitler.. Soviet invasion of Poland   Stalin actively supported German war efforts with providing strategic war materials. “During both the first period of the 1940 agreement (February 11, 1940 to February 11, 1941) and the second (February 11, 1940 until the Pact was broken), Germany received massive quantities of raw materials, including over: 1,600,000 tons of grains900,000 tons of oil200,000 tons of cotton140,000 tons of manganese200,000 tons of phosphates20,000 tons of chrome ore18,000 tons of rubber100,000 tons of soybeans500,000 tons of iron ores300,000 tons of scrap metal and pig iron2,000 kilograms of platinumLarge amounts of crude oil were delivered, with German documents in 1940 already indicating that the Soviets had delivered crude oil at a rate of 150,000 tons a month for five months in 900 German tank cars exclusively reserved for it.” German–Soviet Commercial Agreement (1940) From what I read he was incommunicado in complete shock for two weeks.. Two most important weeks right after invasion.

Stalin was somewhat surprised about the attack, mainly because he did not expect it to come so soon, the Blitzkrieg of France was so quick it didn’t just surprise the Soviet Union, it surprised just about everyone. The USSR would have joined the war sooner or later, when they felt an overwhelming victory was possible of course. But there was no plan to attack Germany in 1941, though they were aware the war would come. The plans in 1941 were about reform and innovation not large offensives. By plan i mean political plan, not military. I am sure the military had many fantasies about moving troops markers around on a map, and doing all kinds of interesting war games, but I have no indication of any actual plans being ordered by Stalin or the Politburo for an attack on Germany before the Germans had already attacked.
